Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 2. Analyze the Data Event Log I need to calculate the duration for each case to identify the slow ones. Case 2001 Start 2024-04-01 0900 Submit Claim End 2024-04-01 1030 Close Claim Duration 1 hour 30 minutes. Attributes Region A Low Complexity. Path Submit Evaluate Approve Pay Close. Happy path no rework loops. Case 2002 Start 2024-04-01 0905 Submit Claim End 2024-04-02 1100 Close Claim Duration 26 hours 1 day 1h 55m. Attributes Region B Medium Complexity. Path Submit Evaluate Request Docs Approve Pay Close. Note One Request Additional Documents event.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3. Synthesize Findings Performance Duration Ranking 1. Case 2004 1.4 hours Fastest 2. Case 2001 1.5 hours 3. Case 2002 26 hours 4. Case 2003 48 hours 5. Case 2005 77 hours Slowest. Correlation with Complexity Low Complexity 2001 2004 1.5 hours average. No additional documents requested. Medium Complexity 2002 26 hours. 1 request for documents. High Complexity 2003 2005 48-77 hours. Multiple requests for documents 2 to 3 times. Insight There is a strong positive correlation between Complexity and Duration. Higher complexity leads to Request Additional Documents loops significantly extending the process.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Correlation with Region Region A Cases 2001 Low 1.5h 2003 High 48h. Region B Cases 2002 Medium 26h 2004 Low 1.4h 2005 High 77h. Insight Region itself doesnt seem to be the primary driver of slowness independent of complexity. However looking at the slowest High Complexity case Case 2005 Region B 77h vs Case 2003 Region A 48h. Region B seems to struggle more with High Complexity claims than Region A. Why Resource analysis might help here. Correlation with Resource Adjusters Adjuster Mike Region A Handled 2001 Low and 2003 High. 2003 took 48 hours had 2 document requests. Adjuster Lisa Region B Handled 2002 Medium 2004 Low and 2005 High. 2005 took 77 hours had 3 document requests.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Root Cause Deep Dive The Request Additional Documents Loop This is the main driver of delay. Case 2002 Medium 1 request. Delay between Evaluation 0945 and Request 1400. Case 2003 High Requests at 1100 and 1700. Case 2005 High Requests at 1130 1700 next day 1500 next day. This suggests an iterative struggle to get documents. Resource Region Interaction Adjuster Lisa Region B handled the slowest case 2005. She requested documents 3 times. Adjuster Mike Region A handled the second slowest 2003. He requested documents 2 times. Both handled High Complexity. Lisas case took longer. Hypothesis Adjuster Lisa might be struggling with High Complexity claims compared to Adjuster Mike 77h vs 48h for similar complexity or Region Bs process for gathering documents is less efficient.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Also Manager Bill approves the high complexity claims. The approval happens the day after the final document request in both cases. Case 2003 Last doc req Apr 1 1700 Approve Apr 2 1600 23h wait. Case 2005 Last doc req Apr 3 1500 Approve Apr 4 1000 19h wait. This indicates a lag in approval for complex cases or a next day batch processing by Manager Bill.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: 5. Refinement of Data Analysis Lets double check the math. Case 2005 High Region B Adjuster Lisa. Evaluate Apr 1 0950. Req Docs 1 Apr 1 1130 Gap 1h 40m. Req Docs 2 Apr 2 1700 Gap 29.5 hours. Req Docs 3 Apr 3 1500 Gap 22 hours. Approve Apr 4 1000 Gap 19 hours. Mike Region A gathered what he needed in 1 day 2 requests on same day. Lisa Region B dragged it out over 3 days requests spread out. This suggests Lisa Region B has a performance issue specifically with handling the documentation gathering for high-complexity claims. The gaps between requests are huge. Approval Bottleneck check Manager Bill Last doc req to Approval gap is 19-23 hours Overnight wait.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Manager Ann Evaluation to Approval gap Low complexity cases. Case 2001 Eval 0930 Appr 1000 30 mins. Case 2004 Eval 0935 Appr 1000 25 mins. Case 2002 Medium Docs Req 1400 Apr 1 Approve 1000 Apr 2 Gap 20 hours. This implies the approval step has a systematic delay for cases requiring documents or Manager Ann processed it next morning. However Manager Bill handles High Complexity. The gap for Bill 19-23h is similar to Anns gap for the Medium case 20h. Conclusion The approval stage introduces a next day delay for any case that isnt instant but the major delay in Case 2005 is the document gathering phase Adjuster Lisa.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: 6. Drafting the Content Part 1 Performance Identification. Rank 2005 Worst 2003 2002 2001 2004. Part 2 Root Cause Analysis. Complexity is the main driver Low 1.5h High 48h-77h. Activity Request Additional Documents is the delay culprit. Resource Adjuster Lisa Region B is associated with the worst performance Case 2005. Her document requests were spread over 3 days. Adjuster Mike Region A handled high complexity faster Case 2003 finishing document needs in 1 day. Manager Bill processes complex claims the approval step adds 20 hours likely due to batching or workload whereas Manager Ann handles simpler claims quickly. Region Region B Case 2005 performed worse than Region A Case 2003 on similar complexity pointing to resource effectiveness Lisa rather than the region itself as the root cause.
